PolicyPage.Name: Community Housing (eligibility)
PolicyPage.Title: Who can live in Community Housing?
PolicyPage.Abstract: This document outlines who can live in Approved Housing.
PolicyPage.BodyCopy:
Full-time Single Students Must Live in Apporoved Housing

All single students under the age of 30 must live in approved housing unless they live at home with their parents. Students who wish to live with a relative must submit a request for an exception and receive approval from the BYU-Idaho Housing & Student Living Exceptions Committee. All off-track students who remain in Rexburg area must also live in approved housing.

 

On-Campus Student-Family Housing Qualifications

In order to qualify to live in on-campus student-family housing at University Village, the contract holder must be a student accepted to a track (matriculating student). Student-family refers to a number of family situations including (but not necessarily limited to) being married without children, divorced, widowed or single students above the age of 30. If you have any questions, contact the Housing & Student Living Office at (208) 496-9220.

 

Community Housing Qualifications

Those who are not required or do not qualify to live in BYU-Idaho approved housing and thus should seek housing in the community include:

 

  1. Individuals who have not been officially admitted to BYU-Idaho or who come to Rexburg prior to their assigned track.
  2. Non-traditional or continuing education students.
  3. Students who are married.
  4. Single students who qualify as a family (have dependent children or are legal guardians of dependent children).
  5. Students who are divorced or widowed.
  6. Students who are married but whose spouse is away for military duty, or who are otherwise not currently living with their spouse.
